title: How to Make Pizza on Tawa

steps.headline: Add 2 cups (473 mL) of all-purpose flour to a medium-sized bowl.
steps.description: Make a hole in the center of the flour using a spoon or your hands.

steps.headline: Add the sugar, salt, olive oil, and yeast to the hole in the flour.
steps.description: Use 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of sugar, ½ teaspoon (2.5 mL) of salt, 2 tablespoons (29.6 mL) of olive oil, and 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of instant yeast. Stir the ingredients together thoroughly.

steps.headline: Knead the dough for five minutes with your hands.
steps.description: As you’re kneading the dough, add 3-4 tablespoons (44.4-59 mL) of lukewarm water to help the dough form into a ball. When you’re finished, the dough should be soft and round.

steps.headline: Set the dough in a greased medium-sized bowl.
steps.description: Grease the inside of the bowl with oil. Set the bowl of dough aside on a counter. Cover the bowl with a dish towel to help the dough rise faster. If you don't have a dish towel, use plastic wrap or parchment paper instead.

steps.headline: Let the dough rise for two hours.
steps.description: After two hours the dough is ready to use. While you’re waiting, prepare any toppings you want to put on the pizza.

steps.headline: Roll out the dough with a rolling pin until it’s ½ inch (1.27 cm) thick.
steps.description: Make sure it will fit on the tawa you’re going to use. If it’s too big, tear off some of the dough and roll it out again so it’s smaller.

steps.headline: Preheat a tawa on a stovetop over medium heat.
steps.description: Place the tawa directly over the burner you’ll be cooking with. Let the tawa preheat for at least one minute.

steps.headline: Cook the dough on the tawa for two to three minutes over medium heat.
steps.description: Make sure the dough is flat and centered on the tawa. Cover the tawa with a lid as you cook the dough.

steps.headline: Flip the pizza crust over with a spatula.
steps.description: Turn down the burner on the stovetop to low. The pizza crust will continue to cook over low heat while you add the toppings.

steps.headline: Spread ½ cup (118.3 mL) of pizza sauce on the crust with a spoon.
steps.description: The crust should still be cooking in the tawa on low at this point. Leave ½ inch (1.27 cm) of space around the perimeter of the crust with the sauce.

steps.headline: Sprinkle ½ cup (118.3 mL) of mozzarella cheese over the pizza.
steps.description: Spread the cheese out evenly over the crust. Leave ½ inch (1.27 cm) of space around the edge of the crust like you did with the sauce.

steps.headline: Add any other toppings you want on the pizza.
steps.description: If you’re adding any vegetables, make sure they’re chopped into small pieces so the pizza is easier to eat. Leave a ½ inch (1.27 cm) space around the edge of the crust like you did with the sauce and cheese.

steps.headline: Cover the tawa and cook the pizza for six minutes on medium heat.
steps.description: Check on the pizza every two minutes to make sure it’s not burning. When the cheese is melted and the bottom of the pizza crust is golden brown, the pizza is finished.

steps.headline: Transfer the pizza to a plate with a spatula and serve.
steps.description: Use a knife or pizza cutter to cut the pizza into slices. Wrap leftover pizza slices in plastic wrap and store in the refrigerator for up to four days.
